TopicTitle: How do I work the rover wheels?

Articles.Content:
Before the uprage mod I could have my rover wheels controled by going to docking mode and doing the normal direction w,s,a,d, keys.

If I do this now the thing will rotate at the same time. 

Obviously this is a bit of an issue. My Minimus fuel base really needs a forklift truck and it will need to move about and rotate as separate things. The I,K,J,L keys don't work either. I think they would be the best option but....

I was able to get 60 mps out of my old Mun rover and need to be able to keep the gyros on to do that sort of racing about.
Just reassign the rover keys to arrows. It's what I did and it works fine.

> 
> Just reassign the rover keys to arrows. It's what I did and it works fine.

How do you do that?

Why are you posting in blue?

And of the settings:

1. Go to the main menu
2. Settings
3. 'Input' tab
4. 'Vessel' tab
5. In the 'Key/Button Bindings' box
6. Scroll down to the 'Wheels' section
7. Change to arrow keys
Just remember that it changes the steering for spaceplanes as well.

Just drive it out of docking mode, and disable any pod torque.

Otherwise, stick a rocket motor on one end, and fixed landing gear on the bottom. That's what I've done for my KSC exploration vehicle, because rover wheels don't unlock for AGES.

And Jeb jumped at the idea of a rocket car.
